results.title: Rego Park, Queens: Finding Value in a Melting Pot
results.abstract: The classic immigrant neighborhood has recently attracted people from other parts of the metropolitan area looking for real estate values.

results.title: $1.5 Million Homes in Vermont, Ohio and Arizona
results.abstract: This week’s homes include a Greek Revival in Vermont, a city house in Ohio and a contemporary in Arizona.

results.title: House Hunting in ... Colombia
results.abstract: High-end properties appreciated more than 10 percent over the last year. And the devaluation of the Colombian peso is attracting more dollar-paying buyers.

results.title: New Apps and Services for Renters
results.abstract: New companies are springing up to help renters find homes, break leases, sublet, find roommates and avoid broker fees.

results.title: Mortgage Approval Entirely Online
results.abstract: Quicken Loans says its newly released product, Rocket Mortgage, will allow borrowers to be fully approved for a purchase or refinance loan online in as little as eight minutes.

results.title: Remaking a Manhattan Block, Right Down to the Ground
results.abstract: The Naftali Group, which is developing two luxury condominiums on a short Upper West Side stretch, is adding a bit of sparkle to the area by using special cement in the sidewalks outside its buildings.

multimedia.caption: An artist's rendering of a condominium being built by the Naftali Group on West 77th Street.

results.title: A Revolving Door Helps Big Banks’ Quiet Campaign to Muscle Out Fannie and Freddie
results.abstract: A behind-the-scenes effort of Wall Street banks to take over the mortgage market is driven by advocates who switch between roles in Washington and the private sector.
org_facet: Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corp (Freddie Mac)

results.title: Nick Sandow, of ‘Orange Is the New Black,’ at Home
results.abstract: The actor and his partner, Tamara Malkin-Stuart, live in a Carroll Gardens, Brooklyn, townhouse.
des_facet: Orange Is the New Black (TV Program)

results.title: High Line Living
results.abstract: A penthouse duplex at the HL23 condominium at the High Line is listed for $22.95 million. The seller is Pierre Lagrange, one of Britain’s richest men.

results.title: Holiday Bonuses for Building Staff
results.abstract: Questions about holiday tipping; slow repairs in a rental; and a costly leak originating from an apartment upstairs.

results.title: A One-Bedroom in the Financial District
results.abstract: Justin Cohen Anderson wanted to rent a one-bedroom apartment in a familiar neighborhood.

results.title: Restoring a Connecticut Farmhouse
results.abstract: A technology entrepreneur restores a farm and renovates a 1935 house in Easton, Conn., fulfilling his longtime dream of owning a country home.

results.title: Central Park Views for $45 Million
results.abstract: Two apartments at the limestone-clad 15 Central Park West — one a duplex on the 18th and 19th floors, and another on the eighth floor — were the sales of the week.

results.title: Clinton Hill, Brooklyn, a Neighborhood in Transition
results.abstract: The centerpiece of the Brooklyn neighborhood is Pratt Institute — its greensward campus’s brick pathways braiding through a sculpture garden.

results.title: Homes for Sale in Brooklyn and Manhattan
results.abstract: This week’s properties are in Hell’s Kitchen, SoHo and Bedford-Stuyvesant, Brooklyn.

results.title: Homes for Sale in New York and New Jersey
results.abstract: This week’s homes include a four-bedroom in Croton-on-Hudson, N.Y., and a five-bedroom in South Amboy, N.J.

results.title: Our Year of Living Airbnb
results.abstract: David Roberts and his wife, Elaine Kuok, couldn’t decide where to live in New York. So they decided to move to a different neighborhood every month for a year.

multimedia.caption: Elaine Kuok and David Roberts return from grocery shopping in their Chelsea neighborhood, where they are staying at a short-term rental secured through Airbnb.

results.title: Small Kitchens, by Choice
results.abstract: Microkitchens, stocked with shrunken appliances, are being embraced by millennials who could easily afford much larger ones.

results.title: A Plumbing Problem: Sludge in the Bathtub
results.abstract: Fixing a pipe, qualifying for tax abatement, and installing smoke detectors.

results.title: Broadway’s Sierra Boggess at Home
results.abstract: The actress Sierra Boggess, a star of “School of Rock,” lives on the Upper West Side.

results.title: Lauren Bacall’s Dakota Apartment Sold for $21 Million
results.abstract: The grand three-bedroom at the landmark Upper West Side co-op building was the sale of the week.

results.title: Putting Down Roots in West Hempstead, N.Y.
results.abstract: Home buyers and renters, particularly those from pricey areas of Brooklyn and Queens, are finding value and varied housing stock in the area.

results.title: Saving a Vital Patch of Olmsted’s Staten Island Eden
results.abstract: Without the Kaasmann property on Staten Island, now subdivided, suburbanized, hemmed in and overgrown, there might be no Central Park, Prospect Park, Riverside Drive or Eastern Parkway.

multimedia.caption: “The builders, in their words, they’re just salivating over this, but we can’t let that happen,” Tina Kaasmann-Dunn said, after local builders determined that the Kaasmann property could be carved up into as many as seven parcels.
multimedia.copyright: Yana Paskova for The New York Times

results.title: An Alley Entrance for a NoHo Condo
results.abstract: Great Jones Alley, between Broadway and Lafayette Street, will assume a more rarefied role when it becomes the exclusive entrance for a 12-story condominium.

multimedia.caption: Great Jones Alley, which will be repaved with Belgian blocks and enclosed with a new gate, is being transformed into a private walkway and driveway for the residents of 1 Great Jones Alley.

results.abstract: The designer Dana Arnett has created an urban oasis for his family and the neighborhood fauna.

results.title: Chinese Cash Floods U.S. Real Estate Market
results.abstract: Some of the Chinese money pouring into the global economy has gone into residential property, in major American cities and places like Corinth, Tex.
results.byline: By DIONNE SEARCEY and KEITH BRADSHER

results.title: HUD Homes at Half Price
results.abstract: A little-known program allows police officers, teachers, firefighters and emergency medical technicians to buy certain homes for half price. But financing comes with some strings attached.

results.title: Homes for Sale in Brooklyn and Manhattan
results.abstract: This week’s properties are in the East Village; in Greenwich Village; and in Park Slope Brooklyn.
